comments.body: Does this need `setuptools` at run time?
Not 100% sure. It was extracted by Grayskull from here: https://github.com/automl/pynisher/blob/0077d7a9b9bd73a729d01bc9da0d9f01d173caa0/setup.py#L20 (I assume)

Original grayskull meta.yaml:

```yaml
{% set name = "pynisher" %}
{% set version = "0.6.3" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/pynisher-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e4e1d9366fc4ca60b4b2354b6d12e65600600a8c7bf4392c84f2f4ff4abc85ff

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python
  run:
    - docutils >=0.3
    - psutil
    - python
    - setuptools

test:
  imports:
    - pynisher
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/automl/pynisher
  summary: A small Python library to limit the resources used by a function by executing it inside a subprocess.
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ADD_YOUR_GITHUB_ID_HERE
```
Yep looks like it. Usually this is needed when `pkg_resources` is used in the library, but didn't see it used. Though agree since they listed it, we should include it.
Ahh ok, TIL!
@mfeurer Would you mind having a quick look at this discussion? Just to make sure that we're not including something that's not needed.

I don't think it's required. It should probably be under `setup_requires`? I'm also not sure why docutils is a requirement (do you see a reason for this?) and why the information that psutil is required is duplicated with requirements.txt.

@jakirkham Is the expert here so it's probably better if he has the final say but yes, `setuptools` is not used anywhere else (https://github.com/automl/pynisher/search?q=setuptools) so I'd assume that it's only needed for the setup.
`docutils` is only listed in the requirements (https://github.com/automl/pynisher/search?q=docutils) so it might be a leftover from a previous version.
psutil being in `requirements.txt` and `setup.py` is probably just a duplicate. Maybe there was a philosophy change. 
`Blame` says that it was added here: https://github.com/automl/pynisher/commit/a3e7ccce7b8075b058ae16b9654b91513f9d2037 so it might be good to double-check with the author of the commit.
In the end, this is only a guess though as I'm not sure if one of these tools was needed at some point and what the philosophy behind adding it was, or if they are used in a context that's not obvious when just examining the repo.

Thanks for the explanation. We'll have a look into cleaning this up. Will new versions automatically be picked up by conda forge and the recipe automatically be updated or does that have to be done manually?

Happy to help! New versions are generally picked up by a bot and proposed through a PR (Similar to https://github.com/conda-forge/pynisher-feedstock/pull/12) but I am watching all upstream repos of the feedstocks I'm maintaining and can then update them manually if there's a problem, so feel free to release any changes you might have. It's just important that they're published as outlined in https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/13919#discussion_r574792176

Also see: https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/updating_pkgs.html#pushing-to-regro-cf-autotick-bot-branch
Thanks a lot for your explanation and the suggestions. There should be a new release soonish which is a bit cleaner here.
Awesome, happy to help! :)
@mfeurer, are you happy to be a maintainer here? 🙂
Already checked 😄 https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/13861#issuecomment-772618036
Oops 🤦‍♂️ Sorry 😬
